text.__SUMMARY__: Common names: Balkan cross adder, Bosnian viper.Vipera berus bosniensis is a venomous viper subspecies endemic to the Balkan Peninsula.
text.Geographic range: It is found only on the Balkan Peninsula.
text.Taxonomy: McDiarmid et al. (1999) follow Golay et al. (1993) and recognize V. b. bosniensis as a subspecies of V. berus. However, it has been considered a full species in recent literature.
